intro: Mirbelia aphylla, commonly known as the hairless mirbelia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often glabrous stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Mirbelia aphylla is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
